bioghist.p: Benjamin Franklin Howell (1917- ) worked in the Geology and Paleontology Department of the Academy of Natural Sciences. He was also on the faculty of Princeton University. He served as President of the Paleontological Society in 1944.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence and other papers of B.F. Howell and other members of the Academy (1929-1948). In addition to Howell, correspondents include Robert G. Chaffee, William T. Clarke, Jr., Mrs. Richard L. Ayer, John Carter Pim, Dorothy M. Reed, and H. de Terra. The correspondence relates to the acquisition, exchange, and examination of specimens, publication of manuscripts, Academy displays (specifically those in the Hall of Earth History), fundraising and planning of expeditions, and field reports from expeditions. The collection also includes a copy of the will of G.W. Tryon Jr.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
